text: Gallium(III) hydroxide is a chemical compound made of gallium, oxygen, and hydrogen. It has the chemical formula . It is sometimes called inorganic gallic acid, and is not to be confused with the organic compound also known as gallic acid. It is a precursor to many gallium compounds. == Chemistry == Like its structural analog aluminium hydroxide, gallium(III) hydroxide is an amphoteric substance: it can act as both an acid and a base depending on what it is reacting with. It forms gallium salts with strong acids, and dissolves in base to make the gallate anion . == References == Category:Amphoteric hydroxides Category:Gallium compounds
title: Gallium(III) hydroxide
